author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Post Graduate and Research Department of English, St. Joseph’s College, in association with Indian Association for Canadian Studies, organised a one-day international conference on Canadian Studies.

The conference was aimed at exploration of geographical, literacy, cultural, social, political, and environmental issues of Canadian literature.

In her keynote address, Yang Gong, Professor of English, Founding Director of Canadian Studies Centre, Beijing Foreign Studies University, offered a retrospective and prospective outlook of Canadian Studies in Canada.

Brenda E.F. Beck, Professor of Anthropology, University of Toronto, Canada, who has made an extensive research on Tamil literature, explained several reasons with a wide range of examples to prove why Tamil Nadu’s Annamar story is fundamental in the contest of world literature.

Om. P. Juneja, former President of International Association for Canadian Studies, and P. Selvam, vice-president, Indian Association for Canadian Studies, and S. Joseph Arul Jayraj, Head of the Department of English, St. Joseph’s College, spoke.
title: Canadian professors attend conference
